TYPED.Definition: wrote on the computer by pressing the keys

ADAPTIVE.Definition: having the ability to change depending on the conditions

INTERACTIVE.Definition: allowing the involvement of the user in the exchange of information

SINKING.Definition: going to the bottom of the sea

ALGORITHMS.Definition: sets of mathematical rules that help computers calculate an answer

RELIABLY.Definition: in a way that can be trusted

INFLUENTIAL.Definition: having a great effect on related things, important

PROMPTS.Definition: information or messages given to a computer

POP-ART.Definition: art based on modern popular culture

ALLERGIES.Definition: conditions that make people sick after eating certain foods

EXAGGERATION.Definition: something that makes it seem more important than it really is

TAPES.Definition: old media for storing audio, cassettes

CLICK.Definition: an act of selecting an option by pressing a button

PATIENT.Definition: able to wait or accept problems without being annoyed

TA-DA.Definition: used to call attention to something amazing

LEVELS THE PLAYING FIELD.Definition: it creates a situation in which everyone has a fair and equal chance of succeeding

THE ELEPHANT IN THE ROOM.Definition: the big problem that is not being talked about

SATISFACTION.Definition: the pleasant feeling you get when you achieve something

SATISFACTORY.Definition: giving the pleasant feeling you get when you achieve something

SPOILER.Definition: information about an important detail that is about to be revealed before its supposed time, leading to a reduced feeling of surprise
